newsitem.title: USA: UroHealth target of securities lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: UroHealth target of securities lawsuit.

text.p: A lawsuit seeking class-action status has been started against Urohealth Systems Inc charging the company and certain of its officers, directors and underwriters with violations of federal securities laws, plaintiffs' attorneys said Monday.

The suit was filed in U.S. District Court for the Central District of California on behalf of purchasers of Urohealth stock during the period July 18, 1996 to July 1, 1997, the law firm of Milberg Weiss said.

The complaint alleges that the defendants issued false statements that drove UroHealth stock to a high of 15-1/8 on August 16, 1996, before falling to as low as 4-3/4, the law firm said in a statement Monday.
Urohealth stock closed Monday at 5-11/16, up 7/16.
Urohealth, based in Newport Beach, California, sells disposable and reusable urological medical and surgical products.
A company representative said the suit was received Friday and forwarded to attorneys.
"We don't have any comment at this time. We have not reviewed the suit with our lawyers yet," said Mike Hawkins, assistant general counsel for UroHealth.
